FuncDef:
The ipv4 reassembling timeout command sets the reassembly timeout period of IPv4 fragments.
The undo ipv4 reassembling timeout command restores the reassembly timeout period to the default value. The ipv4 reassembling timeout command sets the reassembly timeout period of IPv4 fragments. The undo ipv4 reassembling timeout command restores the reassembly timeout period to the default value. By default, the reassembly timeout period of IPv4 fragments is 30s.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the reassembly timeout period of IPv4 fragments.
The value is an integer ranging from 5 to 120, in seconds.

ExtraInfo: To improve device performance and prevent attacks, set a proper reassembly timeout period to ensure that IPv4 fragments that have waited for reassembly for a long time are aged in time.
